teams.description: Interactuar is Kiva's only partner working in and around the city of Medellin, Colombia. Following the violence and political unrest of the 1980s, Medellin is still struggling to find a cultural identity and overcome issues of poverty and a lack of access to basic services. Interactuar offers microcredit, microinsurance and services for clients that include business consulting, education, a nutrition lab, a marketing department and a business start up center!

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Jewish Lending Group
teams.loan_because:
"The greatest level, is to support a fellow by endowing him with a gift or loan, or entering into a partnership with him, or finding employment for him, in order to strengthen his hand until he need no longer be dependent upon others." - Maimonides' Eight Levels of Charity 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                                                                 
"If we donate only to Jewish causes or to individual Jews in need, we may stop seeing everyone as being equally created in God's image and therefore worthy of our help. After all, we are all members of one race, the human race." -- Rabbi Joseph Telushkin
teams.description: Jews and non-Jews from around the world who want to help improve the world, one step at a time.

teams.name: Safe Girls Team
teams.loan_because: By empowering girls and women in the fight for women's rights, poverty reduction, education and health promotion, we are helping to create a fairer and better world for everyone.
teams.description:
This team supports the work of Kiva, improving the lives of people around the world who have limited financial means, and who would not otherwise have the means to improve their lives, those of their families, and their communities.

We also raise awareness of the issues of  violence against girls and women including fgm, education, maternal health and human rights.

This month we deal with the issue of Human Trafficking, a problem fuelled by poverty, and one which affects millions of women and children every year.

 A video explanation of what Trafficking is:

www.no-trafficking.org/

 A personal account:

http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7243612.stm

Videos:

www.theguardian.com/global-development/audioslideshow/2013/dec/11/human-cost-sex-trafficking-prostitution-audio-slideshow

www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-18144333

This four week free of charge course on Human Trafficking begins on 20th August, 2014.

www.coursera.org/course/humantrafficking

 Detailed information about child trafficking:

www.childtrafficking.com/Content/sitemap.php

 To report a trafficking crime:

 In the USA:

www.fbi.gov/about-us/investigate/civilrights/human_trafficking

 In the UK:

teams.name: Randolph (MW) College
teams.loan_because: We are students and we have benefitted from loans: from our parents, from our government and taxpayers, from private banks, from other sources.  Our education would not be possible without these loans, and we see an opportunity to aid others who may not have access to these financial resources.
teams.description: We believe in the beauty and promise of humanity.  We believe we can change the world, and we don't want to wait.  We believe in the future - ours and yours.

teams.name: Elon University: Critical Thinking Class (PHIL 113-D)
teams.loan_because: Our goal is to have a positive impact on one's life by presenting them with the opportunity to improve their own lives and the lives of those around them. We've been blessed with so much, so it is our turn to give back to the world. We hope to inspire others and spread awareness about the social injustice in parts of the world that we'd normally overlook and have fun while doing it!!
teams.description:
As part of our Critical Thinking class at Elon University, we have been assigned a class project with the goal of targeting a specific aspect of society that we find problematic, and then developing and implementing a strategy and a plan of action to address this problem. 
Our class has decided to hold a fundraiser, in the form of a talent show, in which all proceeds and donations will go to KIVA. We are giving to KIVA because we believe in personally connecting with entrepreneurs by empowering them to improve their own lives and the lives of those around them through lending. Additionally, we believe that our efforts will make an exponential impact due to the accountability of the loan recipients.

teams.name: Students Against Global Apathy (SAGA)
teams.loan_because: there is no shortage of intelligence, hard work, ingenuity, or passion in developing countries -- the only thing lacking is opportunity. Kiva is a catalyst for change!
teams.description:
Mission Statement: We inspire and engage youth to become global citizens who creatively solve the problems of our future world. 
*********
Brief Intro: Students Against Global Apathy (SAGA) is a groundbreaking new student organization at the University of Alberta that was literally born very, very late one night in a small tent at the footsteps of Mount Kilimanjaro. SAGA is fun, innovative, 100% non-profit, and we will change your attitude about global poverty. Our mission is simple: to get YOU thinking because you are more powerful than you think. Students are the future of the world and as such, we can determine what kind of world we want to live in and what kind of world we want for future generations. SAGA, as young minds with open hearts, strongly believe that that the suffering of fellow human beings is the greatest shame of our modern society. We seek a world of hope, tolerance and social justice — where poverty is defeated and all human beings on the planet live in peace, security and sustainability. Tsk…. not possible you say. Just watch us.

teams.name: Microfinance Society (Singapore)
teams.loan_because: We are the Microfinance society of Singapore, and we want to loan to borrowers in Asia.
teams.description:
The Microfinance Society (Singapore) was officially set up on 29 September
2009 in Singapore. Our mission is to connect, educate and engage people in
the field of microfinance by creating a forum for innovation and
collaboration, thereby reducing global poverty. We strive to bring people
together who are interested in learning about microfinance, micro-credit,
and related finance, economic, and development topics.

Our objectives are - to provide opportunities to learn about microfinance by
broadening outreach and deepening knowledge, to create connections/contacts
between individuals interested in microfinance, to better share microfinance
information and related opportunities and help individuals involved in
microfinance-related projects, to support MFI-initiatives.

For more information, please visit http://www.microfinance.org.sg

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.

teams.name: Teachers  Rock!
teams.loan_because: We want to support the teachers of the world.  Teachers too often are among the most underpaid, undervalued but incalculably important members of our societies.   We want to support teachers in both their private and professional endeavors as a way of expressing our terrific appreciation for the work that they do and the near infinite ways they give of themselves to our children.
teams.description: We are teachers, former teachers, volunteer teachers, current or former students of teachers, or simply, admirers and valuers of teachers.   We have in common that every one of us can think of at least one teacher in our lives who profoundly touched us or comforted us or inspired us or otherwise affected the ways our minds were expanded or our hearts nourished.  We deeply believe in compassion and sharing and kindness and empathy and community, and we profoundly understand that those qualities don’t evolve automatically in our youth but have to be taught.

teams.name: Kiva Melbourne (pro-savings, against high-interest loans)
teams.loan_because: we naively believed that "loans could change lives" for the better. In fact, high-interest loans often change lives for the worse or simply stop people escaping poverty and becoming financially independent.
teams.description:
This group is now changing. It is against funding high-interest loans and wants Kiva to shift its model to facilitate savings by the poor. I.e. Use our funds to make savings more accessible, safer, lower-cost and higher-yield (e.g. matching funds).

To the original members, please feel free to leave the group if you aren't happy with this change. New members, please only join if you agree with the above.

teams.name: Pirate Party International
teams.loan_because: We think that ideas, knowledge, culture and wealth should be shared by all people, all over the world.

The international Pirate Party movement is a grass roots movement that unites behind the ideas of freedom, sharing and respect. People, all over the world, should be free to think, and to take part of knowledge, ideas and culture – as well as share freely all the above, without fear, and without having their privacy or other rights violated.

We on the Kiva international Pirate Party team also believes that not only ideas, knowledge and culture should be shared by all people worldwide, but also wealth.

Our team focus is on making loans to borrowers who don't use animals in their businesses.
teams.description: We're vegetarians and vegans, and those thinking about making the change.  We welcome everyone regardless of their motivation for going veggie.

teams.name: XanGo Goodness on Kiva!
teams.loan_because: Giving is a core element of XanGo's mission, and the company has supported worthy causes that benefit children and families worldwide since its inception. As XanGo grows, so does its ability to affect more lives, While the XanGo Goodness movement has benefited many thousands worldwide as a branded charitable initiative for XanGo, the time has come to extend XanGo's reach to Kiva!
teams.description: The XanGo Goodness Foundation strives to raise social consciousness and mobilize XanGo's global resources to serve, support and improve communities in need. Of particular interest is improving the lives of children around the world and mobilizing to address disasters and crises.

teams.name: Team CANADA

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising
